required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Provider Alerts to Reduce Unnecessary Care
clinical_study.official_title: Provider Alerts to Reduce Unnecessary Care

brief_summary.textblock: 10 Clinics within Stanford Health Care are randomized to receive or not receive provider alerts for 5 commonly overused tests and treatments.

detailed_description.textblock:
10 Clinics within Stanford Health Care are randomized to receive or not receive provider alerts for 5 commonly overused tests and treatments.
Thus there will potentially be 50 clinics enrolled across the 5 tests/treatment categories. However, it is expected that some clinics will meet criteria to be one of the 10 clinics in more than test/treatment category. Thus the total number of clinics involved will be between 10 and 50.
These 5 tests / treatments are taken from the Choosing Wisely list. All alerts will be provided using the electronic medical record and will be automated.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of electronic orders entered per 100 clinic patients.
primary_outcome.description: There are five primary outcomes for the five different alerts. For each alert study the outcome will be orders that would qualify for an alert per 100 patients.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of potential electronic alerts divided by the number of electronic orders
secondary_outcome.description: There will be five secondary outcomes which will be the alert candidate to order ratio. For both the control and intervention groups we will determine the fraction of orders that qualify for an alert.

arm_group.description: This arm is the intervention arm. This arm will receive the Electronic Record Alert.
This arm is the control arm.

intervention.description: Electronic alert within the medical record indicating the ordered test or treatment may be inappropriate. The provider can indicate why the test or treatment is appropriate and complete the order.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
High volume clinics defined as the top 10 clinics in Stanford Health Care based on number of electronic orders.
Exclusion Criteria:
